resources.string: BYE, BYE! Thanks for using AceB FORTH.
You can exit from here by selecting OK or Cancel to continue working in AceB.
Load up AceB with a memory image?
You can load a memory image which was saved. You don't have to do this to restore the AceB state as it persists. It is to allow you to experiment, and then load up the single saved state.
Save a memory image of AceB?
You can save a memory image to load later. You don't need to save before exiting AceB as the memory is persistent. The image you save via this dialog is backed up in the cloud.

You can reset AceB to the default dictionary. This helps in recovering from crashes. you may be tempted to save then load to recover, but if the dictionary is not in a consistent state, you may have loaded a non working system, and overwritten your backup.
You can enter the source in the editor, as though typed in at once, into AceB. This allows you to decide your commit point.
There was an unexpected problem with input or output. Ignore it?
You can use Cancel to stop the program, or OK to simulate the end of input or success of output.
Help can be displayed by pressing the help button in a dialog, and the OK and Cancel buttons will still function.
